page.title: 17Beacock's Farm (cont)
page.content: Over the last ten years, Machines have taken over many jobs and the use of chemicals to destroy pests and feed the crops has increased. Since Britain joined the E.E.C. the market for the farm's crops has increased. Oil seed rape is the most profitable crop. The biggest expense on the farm is the buying of new machinery and the repair of the old.The farm's worst enemies are pests and weeds. Mr. Beacock does not think Immingham is the best place for a farm because of the pollution from the factories on the Humber Bank and the fact that there are so many houses surrounding his land. (Written by Rachel Forward, Emma Raines, Sarah Somerscales, Billi-Jo Cuthbert, Sherri Ballard)
